TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MailboxAddress extends MimeKit.InternetAddress implements class System.IEquatable`1<class MimeKit.MailboxAddress>

Docs.summary: A mailbox address, as specified by rfc822.
Docs.remarks: Represents a mailbox address (commonly referred to as an email address) for a single recipient.

Docs.param: The character encoding to be used for encoding the name.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new with the specified name and address. The specified text encoding is used when encoding the name according to the rules of rfc2047.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the mailbox address.
Docs.remarks: Represents the actual email address and is in the form of "name@example.com".

Docs.remarks: A route is convention that is rarely seen in modern email systems, but is supported for compatibility with email archives.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString (bool encode);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString(bool encode) cil managed

Docs.param: If set to true, the will be encoded.
Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the , optionally encoding it for transport.
Docs.remarks: Returns a string containing the formatted mailbox address. If the parameter is true, then the mailbox name will be encoded according to the rules defined in rfc2047, otherwise the name will not be encoded at all and will therefor only be suitable for display purposes.

Docs.returns: true, if the address was successfully parsed, false otherwise.
Docs.remarks: Parses a single . If the the address is not a mailbox address or there is more than a single mailbox address, then parsing will fail.
